com.xconns.peerdevicenet

Class RouterConnectionClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xconns.peerdevicenet.RouterConnectionClient

  • public class RouterConnectionClient
extends java.lang.Object
    RouterConnectionClient wrapper class is the preferred way to access the asynchronous one-way AIDL api of Router Connection Service. It enables two-way asynchronous messaging between clients and ConnectionService, and performs some extra book keeping:
    • bind to (later unbind) Router ConnectionService to start a new session and hold session id.
    • expose api methods which invoke ConnectionService one-way asynchronous messaging api as defined by IRouterConnectionService.aidl; perform operations such as retrieving network info, activating network, connecting or disconnecting device.
    • register a ConnectionHandler which exposes client side one-way asynchronous messaging api to allow ConnectionService call back to notify events such as network detachment, device connection and disconnection.
    • buffering api calls when the binding with ConnectionService is not ready, and resend buffered calls when the binding is ready.

    It exposes the following groups of methods in accordance with ConnectionService AIDL api:

    • network detection and management: 
       void getNetworks()
 void getActiveNetwork()
 void connectNetwork(NetInfo net)
 void disconnectNetwork(NetInfo net)
 void activateNetwork(NetInfo net)
    • peer discovery: 
       void startPeerSearch(DeviceInfo groupLeader, int timeout)
 void stopPeerSearch()
    • peer device connection: 
       void acceptConnection(DeviceInfo peer)
 void connect(DeviceInfo peerInfo, byte[] token, int timeout)
 void denyConnection(DeviceInfo peer, int rejectCode)
 void disconnect(DeviceInfo peerInfo)
    • info query: 
       void setConnectionInfo(String devName, boolean useSSL, int liveTime,getDeviceInfo() int connTime, int searchTime)
 void getConnectionInfo()
 void getDeviceInfo()
 void getPeerDevices()

    A sample scenario of using RouterConnectionClient to interact with ConnectionService is as following:

    1. Initialization at onCreate() or onResume(): 
       //first bind to Router ConnectionService, and register ConnectionHandler.
 connClient = new RouterConnectionClient(this, connHandler);
 connClient.bindService();
    2. call service async api to perform operations: 
       connClient.connect(device, securityToken.getBytes(), connTimeout);
    3. cleanup at onPause() or onDestroy(): 
       connClient.unbindService();

    For detailed tutorial on how to use RouterConnectionClient to talk to ConnectionService and set up peer device connections, please check out github sample project.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  RouterConnectionClient.ConnectionHandler
      ConnectionHandler exposes client side async messaging one-way AIDL api to allow ConnectionService call back to notify events such as network attachment and detachment, device connection and disconnection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RouterConnectionClient

        public RouterConnectionClient(Context c,
                              RouterConnectionClient.ConnectionHandler h)
        RouterConnectionClient constructor; register a ConnectionHandler to expose client side one-way asynchronous messaging api for ConnectionService to call back.
        Parameters:
        c - context (activity or service) in which to bind to Connection Service.
        h - register a ConnectionHandler to allow ConnectionService call back.

    • Method Detail

      • bindService

        public void bindService()
        bind to Router Connection Service.

      • unbindService

        public void unbindService()
        unbind from Router Connection Service.

      • startPeerSearch

        public void startPeerSearch(DeviceInfo groupLeader,
                            int timeout)
        start a new search session to find peer devices.
        Parameters:
        groupLeader - info of leader device which may run hotspot or own wifi direct group. It is the enabler for a group of devices to discover each other.
        timeout - search session timeout in seconds; if set to 0, search forever until stopped explicitly; if set to negative, use preset search timeout (default 30 seconds).

      • stopPeerSearch

        public void stopPeerSearch()
        stop current search session.

      • acceptConnection

        public void acceptConnection(DeviceInfo peer)
        accept the connection request from a peer device.
        Parameters:
        peer - info of connecting peer device.

      • denyConnection

        public void denyConnection(DeviceInfo peer,
                           int rejectCode)
        deny the connection request from a peer device and tell the reason.
        Parameters:
        peer - info of connecting peer device.
        rejectCode - reason of denial.

      • connect

        public void connect(DeviceInfo peerInfo,
                    byte[] token,
                    int timeout)
        send connection request to peer device.
        Parameters:
        peerInfo - info of peer device.
        token - binary data for authentication.
        timeout - connection timeout in seconds; if set to 0, wait forever; if set to negative, use preset value (default to 5 seconds).

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(DeviceInfo peerInfo)
        disconnect a connected peer device.
        Parameters:
        peerInfo - info of device to be disconnected.

      • setConnectionInfo

        public void setConnectionInfo(java.lang.String devName,
                              boolean useSSL,
                              int liveTime,
                              int connTime,
                              int searchTime)
        set connection related parameters at Connection Service; they will be used as default hereafter.
        Parameters:
        devName - name of this device appearing to peers.
        useSSL - if use TLS/SSL for peer connections.
        liveTime - the period between successive verifications of peer devices aliveness.
        connTime - socket connection attempt timeout.
        searchTime - peer device search timeout.

      • getConnectionInfo

        public void getConnectionInfo()
        request current connection related parameters at Connection Service. the response is returned at ConnectionHandler.onGetConnectionInfo().

      • getDeviceInfo

        public void getDeviceInfo()
        request current device info (name, address, port) known at Connection Service. the response is returned at ConnectionHandler.onGetDeviceInfo().

      • getPeerDevices

        public void getPeerDevices()
        retrieve info of connected peer devices; the response is returned at ConnectionHandler.onGetPeerDevices().

      • getNetworks

        public void getNetworks()
        retrieve info of attached networks; the response is returned at ConnectionHandler.onGetNetworks().

      • getActiveNetwork

        public void getActiveNetwork()
        request info of the network currently used to connect peer devices. the response is at ConnectionHandler.onGetActiveNetwork().

      • activateNetwork

        public void activateNetwork(NetInfo net)
        choose network as the network used to connect peer devices hereafter.
        Parameters:
        net - info of the network to be activated.

      • connectNetwork

        public void connectNetwork(NetInfo net)
        connect to the specified network.
        Parameters:
        net - info of the network to be activated.

      • disconnectNetwork

        public void disconnectNetwork(NetInfo net)
        disconnect from specified network.
        Parameters:
        net - info of the network to be activated.
